item.description: The Coolidge Corner Theatre's Science on Screen series returns Mon, Oct. 3 with a screening of B-movie maestro Roger Corman's 1960 cult classic The Little Shop of Horrors, about a hapless plant-shop clerk who breeds a talking ("Feed Me! FEEEED ME!"), man-eating plant named Audrey Junior. Before the film, Harvard Forest ecologist Aaron Ellison talks about the bizarre and amazing ways that carnivorous plants lure, trap, and digest their meals and on how these fabulously complex plants can offer insight into how a complete, functioning natural ecosystem works. Program starts at 7:00pm.
item.name: Science on Screen: Little Shop of Horrors with Ecologist Aaron Ellison
